instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: 820 3476 A, No charge battery
threads.message:
Hey, 

working on 820 3476 no charge! already repair this one with <CAPACITOR>C7198</CAPACITOR> shorted to ground. i replace for a new one the machine comes to life but after 1 week came again! 

now, with only charge the machine work's well!
with battery + charger i don't have green light and don't start!  
fake charger + battery the mac turn on but don't pass 1% and indicates charging! 

i compare to  working board on diode mode on pin 1 & 2 <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> and the values it's the same! 

already try new battery same history! 

ideas??

threads.title: 820 3476 A, No charge battery
threads.message:
Seems that original charger detects some leakage on the board and gets blocked.
Can be <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> issue, or something around Q/<DIODE>D7010</DIODE>.
Post exact value (measured onboard, ohm scale) for <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86.

threads.title: 820 3476 A, No charge battery
threads.message:
hey ,

already replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> for new one no changes! 

<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7181</RESISTOR> - resistance float 21k - 55k  check with another working board and the values don't float! What could be wrong?

<RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86 - 470K/330K

threads.title: 820 3476 A, No charge battery
threads.message:
Did you put new <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>???
Resolder it; be sure is correctly placed...

threads.title: 820 3476 A, No charge battery
threads.message:
Yes i did! i have already tried 3 new <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> and same history the resistence float!! i remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> of working board and i measure <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> and i noticed that resistance don't float! i think the problem only can be on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> or the connection pin2 <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> to the gate <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>! But the problem is <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. I replace and the board work's well!!

thank you  one more time
